channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Service of removal for Maguiresbridge murder victims to be held
item.description: A service for Vanessa Whyte and her children, James and Sara Rutledge, will be held in Maguiresbridge.

item.title: Cat Deeley and Patrick Kielty announce separation
item.description: The presenters, who married in 2012, made the announcement in a joint statement.

item.title: Future of Tollymore outdoor activity centre 'under review'
item.description: Sport NI say the Bryansford based facility will remain closed while they carry out the review.

item.title: Most-watched shows and changing viewing habits revealed
item.description: Research from Ofcom suggests viewers in Northern Ireland watched more live TV that those in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Former garda jailed for inciting rape
item.description: Shane Flanagan impersonated a female colleague on a fetish website without her knowledge.

item.title: Man appears in court over crash that killed Bangor teenager
item.description: Jaidyn Rice was 16 years old when she died after she was hit by a car on the West Circular Road

item.title: Wayne Rooney recalls 'great memories' of Super Cup NI ahead of son's match
item.description: Rooney told BBC News NI he is delighted to be in Coleraine to watch his son Kai play.

item.title: Former senior PSNI officer to become UUP MLA
item.description: He is replacing North Antrim MLA Colin Crawford, who is stepping down after less than a year in the role.

item.title: Many 'stuck in bed for days without care', Covid inquiry hears
item.description: On behalf of Disability Action, Joanne Sansome says staff shortages in the care sector meant many were stuck for days without direct care.

item.title: I expected 80s Belfast to be a 'warzone', says Fatboy Slim
item.description: The Right Here, Right Now DJ says Belfast hits all the right notes ahead of his Boucher Playing Fields gig.

item.title: Irish government announces new Garda commissioner
item.description: The new Garda commissioner who will be in place for the next five years will be Justin Kelly.

item.title: Troubles investigation group makes first witness appeal
item.description: It is the first public appeal by the Independent Commission for Reconciliation and Information Recovery since it began operating.

item.title: Man sentenced to death over killing of Irish soldier Seán Rooney
item.description: Pte Seán Rooney was in an armoured UN vehicle which came under fire while travelling to Beirut on 14 December 2022.

item.title: Wiffen 'really weak' before Worlds 800m final
item.description: Olympic gold medallist Daniel Wiffen feels "something's going wrong" with his performances at the World Aquatics Championships in Singapore.

item.title: Gonorrhoea vaccination appointments open
item.description: Gonorrhoea is now the most prevalent STI diagnosed in sexual health clinics in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Sue Gray appointed to university's governing body
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer's former chief of staff is one of four new members of the senate at Queen's University Belfast.

item.title: Faster than Rory, further than Bryson - life on golf's 'party' side
item.description: Northern Ireland's Aaron Lennie takes BBC Sport into the world of Long Drive, the party version of golf where big hitting is all that counts.

item.title: Football clubs issue joint statement condemning violence
item.description: Both clubs expressed "great regret" over the disturbances which they said "endangered the safety of genuine fans".

item.title: Senior surgeon appointed to tackle NI waiting lists
item.description: Professor Mark Taylor will be Northern Ireland's first regional Clinical Director for Elective Care.

item.title: NI recall of spinach and mixed leaves after listeria detection
item.description: The products are produced by McCormack Family Farms, who supply to Lidl, Dunnes Stores and Musgrave Ltd.

item.title: Ringrose ruled out of third Lions Test
item.description: Centre Garry Ringrose is ruled out of the British and Irish Lions' third Test against Australia on Saturday as he continues to recover from a head injury.

item.title: Linfield board at 'wits' end' after Uefa fine - Healy
item.description: Linfield manager David Healy says the board are "at their wits' end" after the club were fined 12,000 euro for spectator misconduct in Champions League qualifying.

item.title: Belfast Zoo to reopen as water supply restored
item.description: The zoo temporarily closed its doors on Sunday and Monday to carry out "essential maintenance" works.

item.title: Maguiresbridge murder victims will be buried together in County Clare
item.description: A service for Vanessa Whyte and her children, James and Sara Rutledge, will also be held in Maguiresbridge on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Ballymena United honour young fan's life with new kit design
item.description: Ballymena United's manager has said a young fan who died in a car crash will be honoured in their new kit

item.title: Lioness star Chloe Kelly's 'Omagh blood' helped win Euros says relative
item.description: Lioness striker Chloe Kelly's relative Liam Nugent, 79, watched "every game" of the Euros from his living room in Omagh.

item.title: Why NI is a 'Goldilocks' area for renewable home heating
item.description: A Rural Housing Association complex in County Antrim is using heat from the earth to warm rooms.

item.title: Donating milk an opportunity to 'care for other babies'
item.description: The service at the South West Acute Hospital supports premature and sick babies in neonatal units throughout Ireland.

item.title: Belfast TradFest 'top of the traditional map'
item.description: Belfast TradFest starts on Sunday 27 July with special guests Dervish opening the festival with a concert.

item.title: BBC Newsline signed summary
item.description: BBC Newsline signed summary

item.title: Belfast Pride's 2025 theme strikes defiant note
item.description: Large crowds attended this year's parade in Belfast city centre.

item.title: The four presidential puzzles Sinn Féin needs to solve
item.description: Enda McClafferty looks at the questions Sinn Féin has to answer ahead of the Irish presidential election later in the year.

item.title: Childminder said she loved murdered children 'like they were her own'
item.description: A vigil is planned for Vanessa Whyte and James and Sara Rutledge, who were killed in a suspected triple murder and attempted suicide.

item.title: School to remember murdered brother and sister 'for years to come'
item.description: Sara, who was 13, and her 14-year-old brother James were both pupils at Enniskillen Royal Grammar School.

item.title: Social worker says ministers need to do more to protect abuse victims
item.description: The cousin of a woman murdered in 2017 says the government must to do to protect victims of domestic abuse

item.title: Rocky Horror Show cast join calls for Magenta statue in Belfast
item.description: The cast of the Rocky Horror Show have paid homage to one of the show's original stars, Patricia Quinn, who is from Northern Ireland.

item.title: Vigil held for murdered mother and two children
item.description: Mourners gather at victims' former primary school to pay tribute to the family killed in a shooting.

item.title: Fishermen say Lough Neagh pollution cannot be allowed to end eel fishing
item.description: It comes as a consultation is being conducted into controversial water quality measures.

item.title: Féile an Phobail a 'window to the world' for west Belfast
item.description: Féile an Phobail, billed as Ireland's biggest community arts festival returns this weekend.

item.title: Mum and children killed in shooting 'valued and much loved'
item.description: Police say a triple murder and attempted suicide is one line of inquiry and appeal to anyone who spoke to the victims recently.

item.title: 'My three children needed transplants, now I'm giving back'
item.description: Willie Hutchinson volunteers to transport patients to and from hospital appointments after his children relied on the service.

item.title: Summer holidays bringing parents financial 'anxiety'
item.description: It comes as research by Ulster University suggests more parents are cutting back on children's sports due to the rising costs of living.

item.title: Young singers 'angry' as NI choir faces closure over funding cut
item.description: Northern Ireland's only national youth choir faces closure due to a funding cut from the Arts Council of Northern Ireland.

item.title: Thousands line streets for SuperCupNI team parade
item.description: SuperCupNI, now in its 42nd year, will bring together 1,200 footballers from 62 elite youth teams.

item.title: House destroyed in arson attack
item.description: Police received a report of a fire on the Seacoast Road near Limavady shortly after 02:00 BST.

item.title: Tour guides for deaf people 'will encourage inclusivity'
item.description: Six people from the north west qualify as tour guides for the deaf community.

item.title: Two taken to hospital after disorder in Londonderry
item.description: Disorder occurred before and after a match between Derry City and Bohemians in the city.

item.title: Union flag theft on Queen's birthday treated as 'sectarian hate crime'
item.description: The union flag was stolen from outside a civil service building in Derry and replaced with the Irish tricolour.

item.title: Council backs Palestine Action motion against own legal advice
item.description: Derry and Strabane Council has called for charges against supporters of the banned group Palestine Action to be dropped.

item.title: Meenagh confirmed as Derry senior manager
item.description: Ciaran Meenagh is named the new Derry senior football manager.

item.title: A 'void of political leadership' over Derry bonfire, DUP says
item.description: The bonfire on private land in Meenan Square is holding up a £11m development, the DUP says.

item.title: Man charged with arson following house fire
item.description: The suspect, 38, was charged after a house in Londonderry was damaged by fire on Monday night.

item.title: Sewer roadworks paused during Foyle Cup after traffic 'chaos'
item.description: Motorists faced lengthy delays in various parts of Londonderry on the opening day of the Foyle Cup.

item.title: Foyle Cup kicks off with city centre parade
item.description: Young footballers from across the world are in Londonderry for the 2025 Foyle Cup.

item.title: Ireland 'not exactly celebrating' Trump's deal with EU
item.description: US President Donald Trump and European Commission Ursula von der Leyen announced on Sunday that they have agreed a US tariff on all EU goods of 15%.

item.title: New surgical hub planned for Donegal after complaints
item.description: Some clinicians were unhappy when Letterkenny University Hospital was left out of original plans.

item.title: Kerry dash Donegal's dream in All-Ireland final
item.description: Kerry win the All-Ireland Senior Football Championship for the 39th time with a 1-26 to 0-19 victory over Donegal in Sunday's final at Croke Park.

item.title: Creeslough victims' families launch civil case
item.description: The blast, which killed 10 people, happened at a service station in the County Donegal village on 7 October 2022.

item.title: Can Ireland deliver on €112bn infrastructure plans?
item.description: Housing and the Dublin Metro are among projects being given big cash injections.

item.title: Fans confident 'Big Jim' can do it again for Donegal
item.description: The anticipation is building in County Donegal ahead of the showdown against Kerry at Croke Park.

item.title: Crime boss told to pay £1m or face more jail time
item.description: Thomas Kavanagh will have three months to pay more than £1m or face another 12 years.

item.title: Pub owned by Conor McGregor set on fire in Dublin
item.description: Emergency service attended the fire at the Black Forge Inn at about 03:00 local time.

item.title: Food supplier brings in expert over listeria outbreak
item.description: One person has died and nine cases of listeriosis have been identified in the Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Radio 1 did not edit Irish out of CMAT song, BBC says
item.description: The first 45 seconds of the song are in Irish, but did not feature in the first broadcast on the BBC.

item.title: Adult dies with listeriosis as outbreak investigated
item.description: The death follows news announced on Tuesday that nine cases of listeriosis have been identified.

item.title: Topshop returning to high street in Donegal department store
item.description: A County Donegal department store is to be the first to sell the Topshop range as part of it high street relaunch

item.title: Irish sporting pioneer Kyle dies aged 96
item.description: Maeve Kyle became Ireland's first female track and field Olympian at the 1956 Games and then a highly respected athletics coach.

item.title: Three people rescued from sinking fishing vessel
item.description: The rescue operation happened off the coast of Donegal in the Republic of Ireland on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Irish government reveals how Apple tax windfall will be spent
item.description: The money is being used to beef-up the Republic of Ireland's National Development Plan.

item.title: Husband jailed for life for murdering wife at their Dublin home
item.description: Stephen Mooney, from Kilbarrack Road, originally pleaded not guilty to killing 43-year-old Anna Mooney in 2023.
